basics.name: Ahmed Mohammed
basics.label: DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Hello, I'm Ahmed Mohammed, a passionate DevOps Engineer with expertise in cloud computing, automation, and infrastructure management. I thrive on optimizing development processes and enhancing system reliability. With a strong background in both development and operations, I bridge the gap between these two domains to deliver seamless and efficient solutions. My goal is to leverage my skills to drive innovation and efficiency in every project I undertake.

work.name: Sonata Software/Bluestem Brands
highlights: Led the successful completion of a 3-year cloud migration project, transitioning enterprise infrastructure from an on-premises data center to AWS, resulting in improved system performance, cost efficiency, and scalability
Refactored legacy Chef cookbooks to ensure compatibility and optimal performance with newly migrated AWS-based servers, improving configuration reliability and deployment efficiency.

Successfully migrated 400+ on-premise microservices, applications, and Linux environments to AWS, leveraging automation tools and IaC (Terraform & Chef) to reduce deployment time by 40%, improving system scalability and reliability.
Developed and maintained CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins ensuring seamless application deployments while achieving zero customer-facing downtime.
Delivered 24/7 on-call support for critical Linux-based infrastructure, ensuring rapid response and resolution of major incidents to maintain system uptime and reliability.

projects.name: Video to Audio Microservices App
projects.description: Deployed a scalable microservices-based application using Python, AWS EKS, Docker, and Helm, enabling video-to-audio conversion. Leveraged RabbitMQ for asynchronous processing and utilized MongoDB and PostgreSQL for efficient and scalable storage of video data
